sentences: Üliõpilane elas viie seltsimehega ühes toas.
context: The Estonian word 'seltsimees' combines 'seltsi' (society, company) and 'mees' (man), literally meaning society-man or companion. It has two main uses: 1) A general term for a companion, mate, friend, or someone sharing activities or situations, like roommates or travel companions; 2) In communist contexts, it was used as an official form of address equivalent to 'comrade'. The word can be singular (seltsimees) or plural (seltsimehed), and follows standard Estonian grammatical declension patterns.
